message_1:
Let's say we have an encrypted message using the Caesar cipher with a shift of 7. Using frequency analysis, a math student needs to determine the original message from the following encrypted text:

"yltypjlz hss pz paohsh!"

Note: The message only contains lowercase letters and spaces.
message_2:
To decrypt a Caesar cipher with a shift of 7, we need to shift each letter back by 7 positions in the alphabet. Here's the decryption process for the given encrypted text "yltypjlz hss pz paohsh!":

y -> t
l -> e
t -> o
p -> i
y -> t
j -> c
l -> e
z -> s
(space)
h -> a
s -> l
s -> l
(space)
p -> i
z -> s
(space)
p -> i
a -> t
o -> h
h -> a
s -> l
(space)

The decrypted message is: "toitlecs all is itahl!"
